title: Displayed text is too small
content:
About a week ago (Jan 4th , 2023 or so) I noticed that my folder and email title text was too small. So I did a search to find out how to fix this. According to a search of this support site, there were two ways to do this. I tried both - and neither worked. There was no change in text size at all. Control + and Control - also didn't work. But when I click on a message to view it, then Control + and Control - work fine. It's just that the overall Thunderbird display text is too small and I can't seem to change it. Is there some trick that I'm not aware of?

I'm running Thunderbird 102.6.1.
creator: Don-Peters

title: Office 365
content: Hi, i have recently transferred to Office 365 account, i synchronized it with thunderbird and my inbox works for some time snd then suddenly stops, any ideas? Thanks
creator: michl.tomas

title: configurazione account mail
content: Salve, non riesco a configurare vari account di posta dal mio dominio. I dati inseriti sono corretti ma durante al configurazione rimane bloccato sul controllo password per giorni interi. Ho provato anche la migrazione da outlook, dove ho già tutti gli account configurati ma senza risultati. Premetto però che con le versioni precedenti di thunderbird non ho avuto problemi perchè su altri pc riuscii a configurarlo senza problemi. In attesa di Vs riscontro si inviano Cordiali Saluti

title: my html signature file is modified/corrupted when it is attached to the message
content:
Hello,

I have a problem with the html signature. Since several months, no matter what html file I use as signature , in the message it always looks like below. If I use a text signature it works ok, but any html signature is converted to the below string of strange characters. ( I also attached a screen shot).

What can I do to fix it?

Thank you, Mihai

title: all my PDF attachments when saved/opened became invalid empty 0 bytes files
content:
Hello,

I have problem opening/saving PDF attachments. Recently I started to also have troubles with ".doc" attachments.

If I want to open the PDF attachment in Thunderbird I get an blank page. If I want to save it, the saved file is empty and in folder it shows 0 bytes although in the message the attachments the file has the right size. If I choose open with Acrobat reader , absolutely nothing is happening, the Acrobat do not open, now file is displayed.

Other colleagues can open the same message in Thunderbird and see/save pdf attachments without problems. I reinstalled both Thunderbird and Acrobat reader without any change


What else should I try? I attach 2 screenshots.

( recently I started having troubles with ".doc" attachments as well)

Thank you, Mihai
creator: mihai3

content:
salve, non trovo più i messaggi di posta in arrivo e inviata sulla casella di posta. Facendo però un controllo tramite la ricerca globale, appaiono nei risultati di ricerca i messaggi andati persi ma quando faccio clic su un messaggio nei risultati di ricerca per visualizzarlo non mi da nessun risultato.

nella ricerca globale vedo parte dei testi di ogni singola mail e quale file sia allegato.

Sapreste fornire assistenza? Grazie
creator: SumoBot

title: Email file size being reduced
content:
I set up Thunderbird on NEW HP laptop with Windows 11. When I receive an email with a large file size, it is cut short. Example, when I open a 2mb email to read it, it gets cut down to 104kb and only a small fraction of embedded images are visible. Is there a setting I can change to prevent this?

Been using Thunderbird for years on several computers. Love it. This is the first time this has ever been an issue.

If I pull the same IMAP email up using webmail instead, all images and complete email still visible.

Current version installed is 102.6.1 (64 bit)
creator: severalacres

title: Import Open PGP-Key
content: Hello, in Thunderbird versions 102.6.1 and 109.03b I can install my Open PGP key from a file. In the account management, the message appears that I do not have a personal key. Although this key is displayed in the key management, the encryption and signing only works with a newly created key from Thunderbird. Is there a solution for this?

title: Error? Answering of an existing mail with changing sender results in not sending ist without any error message
content: My first try: IMAP: Taking an existing mail, changing sender to another in TB existing and working mail account results in a not sended mail. Sended mail ist not in folder send. Looks like it is not possible to change the sender to another account. All this without any error being displayed. To me this is a bug. Karl

title: Calender ics import
content:
Hello,

For my job I had to create an ics which wasn't the issue. The issue arises when reimporting the ics into Thunderbird. The ics itself isn't broken in some way, I think. I've had someone else look over it and they said it looks fine. Importing the ics into the Windows Calender works perfectly fine also.I don't think that my version of Thunderbird is to old either, I downloaded it yesterday from the Thunderbird Website so it's on version 102.6.1. If it helps there's a error message when reimporting the ics and the error code is MODIFICATION_FAILED. I really don't know how to fix it and it is critical that I fix it soon. Please help. Thank you.

title: Failure porting Mail Messages area
content:
This is my 1st post, but I'm probably a decade user over at least 3 computers. So, thanks to you already!

I'm porting a large profile (12GB) from a Windows 10 PC (Tbird 102.6.1 32-bit) to a Windows 11 PC (Tbird 102.6.1 64-bit).

I followed the directions for Importing the Appdata folder manually. If I try to import all 4 areas at once, Accounts and Settings Address Books Calendars Mail Messages ..it stops in a few seconds and displays... Import failed unexpectedly, more information may be available in the Error Console.

Importing each area individually, fails only on the largest area: Mail Messages

Hope you can help.
creator: robbif

title: Folders do not appear Ubuntu 18.04 Thunderbird 102.4.2
content: Ubuntu 18.04 Thunderbird 102.4.2 Just happened today, everything was working yesterday after update and upgrade (which I believe did not include Thunderbird). Left and right windows are blank. Can send emails, receive email arrival notifications, and view address books and filters, but cannot view folders, folder contents, and messages. Have rebooted, reloaded Thunderbird, tried moving a profile from another computer with no success. Have also noted that calendar tab does not appear. Tried troubleshooting with extensions disabled. What might I have missed? Thanks, in advance, for any help.
creator: bruce.w.benjamin

Con l'ultima versione non mi è più comparsa la rubrica in funzione negli altri dispositivi, anche se avviene la sincronizzazione per i nuovi contatti. Come posso fare per recuperare contatti e rubriche precedenti anche sull'ultimo dispositivo in cui ho installato Thunerbird? Grazie.

title: Can't Accept Calendar Invitations
content:
I've been using Thunderbird for work for a few years and a few months ago my calendar integration with my Google Calendar stopped working. I've tried everything I can think of including re-installing calendars, but without success. My Thunderbird at home can still accept invites, but not on my work computer despite verifying that the calendar address and such is the same.

Initially, when I'd click 'Accept' on an invite, nothing would happen (ie no prompt, failure etc), the invite would just stay there without response. Now it's asking me if I want to link it with one of two different calendars I have, both of which I've verified under the calendar on Thunderbird that it isn't associated with an email address (has the yellow bar at the top saying if you want to use this calendar to store invitations you need to associate with an email address).

I can't think of what to do for next steps for troubleshooting, any thoughts?
creator: SumoBot

title: Non riesco ad usare out.alice.it dall'estero
content:
In Italia mi connetto ad internet con TIM ed ho un account mail alice per via del fatto che sono cliente TIM. Dall'estero (Regno Unito) sto provando ad usare il mio account mail di alice tramite client di posta locale (Thunderbird 78.14.0 su Windows 7) usando le impostazioni IMAP ed SMTP fornite qua https://www.tim.it/assistenza/assistenza-tecnica/mail/configurazione/protocolli-posta Il server IMAP si connette senza problemi e scarica tutti i miei messaggi, mentre non riesco in nessun modo ad usare il server SMTP per la posta in uscita; quello che ottengo quando provo a spedire una mail è un messaggio di Thunderbird che dice "Si è verificato un errore durante l’invio della posta. Il server di posta ha risposto: Message refused. Controllare il messaggio e riprovare." Visto che il server IMAP si connette senza problemi sarei orientato a pensare che non ci sia un blocco da parte di TIM nel fare usare il server SMTP out.alice.it solo da connessioni ad internet fornite da TIM (come invece avviene per gli account mail tin.it ed il rispettivo server SMTP smtps.tin.it).

Vorrei capire se sia normale che il server SMTP out.alice.it non possa essere usato dall'estero o se invece io stia sbagliando ad impostare qualcosa.

Le impostazioni iniziali che ho usato (poi ne ho provate altre ma sempre senza successo) per il server SMTP sono le seguenti. Nome server: out.alice.it Porta: 587 Nome utente: mio_indirizzo@alice.it Metodo di autenticazione: Password normale Sicurezza della connessione: STARTTLS

Come posso fare per usare un server SMTP di TIM dall'estero con Thunderbird per il mio account alice?

Grazie
creator: jielink1978

title: System-Indepedent way to reference user's profile directory/folder in userChrome.css?
content:
Is there a system-indepedent way to reference my current profile directory/folder in userChrome.css? Perhaps a variable, resource, protocol, or something else? Or must I always use the full pathname?

I currently use the following for an image file: 

     url("file://C:/Users/markb/AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird/Profiles/0kcfwlvm.default/chrome/images/gray_polarity_header.png")


The problem with this is that the full pathname is system-dependent.

I tried the following, because I thought that a relative path was supposed to be relative to the CSS file itself, but it doesn't work. 

     url("images/gray_polarity_header.png");      url("file:images/gray_polarity_header.png");      url("data:images/gray_polarity_header.png");


I see things like this when I use the Developer Toolbox: 

     src="chrome://branding/locale/brand.properties"


I assume "chrome:" here refers to some location on disk or some resource in some file. Is there perhaps something like "profile:" to refer to the user's profile directory?

Thanks
creator: mozilla.org.firefox.sync

title: migrate some, but not all, email accounts to second computer without losing any saved messages
content: I want to migrate 6 (4 POP and 2 IMAP) accounts, and retain 1 (POP) account. Can I simply migrate all accounts to the second computer and then remove unwanted accounts on both computers? If not, what will work without losing any messages in any folder in any of the 7 accounts? (Objective: End up with only my business account on one computer, and only my personal accounts on the other.)
creator: burke.fort

title: Thunderbird Crash on startup - Pop3 - Profile file?
content:
Hello,

I have been using Thunderbird portable for awhile and have had no issues. I have to use Pop3 due to work and everything is fine.

Today I open Thunderbird and it crashes right away. I reinstalled it and moved file over and the only way to get it to open is to replace the profile file in the data folder. Problem is then I lose all my emails and I have some important ones.

Is it possible to even just restore all my emails?

Thank you.

title: TB 102 sender's profile photo not shown
content:
When I receive Emails (or send them) i can not see the profiles contact picture (not directly, not with mouse over). This seems to work for others (as posted here: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1382453#answer-1557451) but i can't get it to work.

The Contacts do have profile pictures of course and I can see the picture in the adress book. I use the official adressbook by the way - deinstalled cardbook for some time now.

I would really appreciate a solution.

Thanks, Stefan
creator: Linkinsoldier

title: Using Thunderbird with Extended Displays
content:
I recently started using Thunderbird with the dual display extended mode of Windows 10. I prefer to use Thunderbird on the large extended monitor by sliding it over the extended desktop to the large monitor (#2); no issues. However, email notifications still appear on the PC monitor (#1). There doesn't appear to be away the slide the notifications over to the large monitor (#2).

Is there away to have the notifications appear on the same display as the Thunderbird App?

X.
creator: xytsrm

title: Donation page
content:
Around Dec.1-2022 I started receiving a "notice", asking for a donation to "Thunderbird". This was NOT an email, it just shows up EVERY TIME I go to the "Thunderbird" site. I DID send a donation to "Thunderbird", AND a like amount to "Mozilla", near the end of Dec. Even got a "thank you" response, for the donation. It is NOW 11 Jan. 2023, and I'm STILL getting a request for a donation, EVERY TIME I go to the "Thunderbird" site. How do I remove the DONATION request until late Dec. of 2023?? Thanks-Joel Payne "flyplayne@bellsouth.net"


Welcome to Thunderbird Support us! Donate Support Us

Thank you for supporting Thunderbird, which is funded by users like you! Producing Thunderbird requires software engineers, designers, system administrators and server infrastructure. So if you like Thunderbird, the best way to ensure Thunderbird remains available is to make a donation. Donate Help

Curious about helping? You don’t need to be an expert or know how to code to help other users or offer suggestions about improving the experience! Join us in this open source project where anyone can participate in the Thunderbird community. Get Involved

Share ideas and feedback. Mozilla Connect

Help make Thunderbird better. Get the Beta Questions? Problems?

Post your general Thunderbird usage questions or problems on the support page, where many knowledgeable users can help you. Support Page Report

Think you’ve found a new problem or rough edge? Create a bug report so we can make sure it gets solved, resulting in a better Thunderbird experience for all. Report a Bug Crashed?

If Crash Reporter appears when Thunderbird crashes, please provide as many details as possible to help developers. 

   In Thunderbird do Help > More Troubleshooting Information, scroll to "Crash Reports", click a recent report link to open the crash report page.    Click the Bugzilla tab, then click on an existing bug report under "Related Bugs" and add a comment to the bug, or click "Thunderbird" to submit a new bug report.

Crash Reporter

title: Filter Rule on 'Return-Path'
content: I have a Filter Rule that if a Sender is in a custom 'Contacts List' titled Auto-Delete then the email is to be deleted (and also sometimes deleted from the POP Server as well depending on the Server Settings) because I have manually marked it as unwanted / spam / trash by adding the sender to this custom 'Contacts List'. Some emails manage to hide the sender so they can not automatically be blocked but the emails can be distinguished from the 'Return-Path' when viewing Headers as 'All'. The source of the spam / marketing / junk emails is visible under the 'Return-Path'. There is no option in the Filters Rules to use the 'Return-Path' for any filters. Firstly this needs to be added with all these spam, scam, trash and rubbish emails. How do we customize Thunderbirds Filters to use the 'Return-Path' so that if 'Return-Path' is in a 'Contacts List' those emails are also automatically deleted also?
creator: technician1

title: Outlook and Gmail stopped working with Thunderbird, Windows 7, TB 102.6.1 (64-bit)
content: This happened around the beginning of December 2022. Yahoo mail still works fine. I've updated to the latest version and tried everything I could find on the web, including here. The automatic settings are to the right ports, Oauth2, etc. The error message I'm currently getting says "Unable to log in at server. Probably wrong configuration, username, or password." The user name and password are in fact correct. Thanks for any help you can give me.
creator: SumoBot

title: Filter on body does nothing
content:
I have tried many times to create a filter that triggers if a message body contains a word. I have never gotten any of them to work. I've already read issues on this forum that seemed relevant, but nothing I've done has worked.

I'm using Thunderbird version 102.6.1 (64-bit) running on Windows 7.

These are my filter settings: 

  Manually Run   Getting New Mail: Filter before junk classification   Match all of the following/Match any of the following (tried both)     Body   Contains   unsubscribe   Run selected filter(s) on <the folder where I have test messages>   Perform these actions:      I've tried:         Move to another folder         Star         Delete

I'm not trying the filters on my Inbox yet. I'm using some test folders instead. They are set to download to my system. I did that as follows: 

  Account Settings | Synchronization & Storage | Message Synchronizing | Advanced | Items for Offline Use | "download" enabled for my test folders.  I did not enable "Keep messages..." because that will affect all the folders.  I enabled downloading only for my test folders.

and 

  Folder Properties | Synchronization | 'Select this folder for offline use' enabled, 'Download now' clicked.

My test folder contains messages that have the word that the filter is searching for, "unsubscribe", in both the plain text part of the message, and the html part.

Every time I run the filter, it does nothing. The filter is enabled. The filter log is enabled. The Filter Log is empty.

I've done these things: -- Run it from the Message Filters dialog box by clicking the "Run Now" button. -- Selected my test folder and run Tools | Run Filters On Folder -- Selected a message that has the matching word, and run Tools | Run Filters On Message. -- Looked in my profile folder, found the file corresponding to my test folder, looked in that file, and verified that the message is there, and that the word "unsubscribe" is there. -- Forced rebuilding of the global database by deleting global-messages-db.sqlite. -- Run the filter while online, and while offline. -- Changed the filter to match From Is In my address book, and Star or Move the message, and verified that the filter works with these other settings.

If I run Edit | Find | Search Messages, and search for the word in the body, the messages are found, but only if "Run search on server" is enabled. If it is not enabled, no messages are found. As I stated above, I've already verified that the messages are in a file in my profiles folder.

No matter what I try, filtering on body contents never does anything.

What else should I try?
creator: drkaden

title: Email Folders Don't Always Sync
content:
Hi. I have been using Thunderbird successfully with my email account for years. Recently a new problem has appeared. Generally, if I create a subfolder in Thunderbird I see it in the Comcast webmail, and vice versa. Sometimes, however, it doesn't carry through. I have some that are visible in webmail but don't show up in Thunderbird. I have removed and re-added the account to Thunderbird. Still they don't show up. I have checked with Comcast Support and they say that the account is fine. Is there something I can do to fix this? Thanks for any help you can offer.

Jeff

It is only with this email address [email]@bigpond.com my other email address (hotmail) is fine?? Thanks in advance for any assistance you can provide. Simon Ewen

title: Can't receive or send messages
content:
Just within the last couple of weeks Thunderbird has been unable to get new messages. I tried all the standard fixes. (Settings, firewall, antivirus, even did a clean reinstall)

I noticed I can log in on port 110 and messages are downloaded. But I get nothing when I use TSL and port 995, which are the settings my ISP suggest. It's like the connection just stalls. I have no idea what to do. Suggestions?
creator: proteus1

title: Make "Followup" the first button (before "Reply") for NNTP
content:
I was using an extension for this, that seems to be unsupported in my current (109.0b4 (64-bit)) version of Thunderbird.

In NNTP/Newsgroups it's really most appropriate to have "Followup" be the first button... I find myself constantly wanting to reply (publicly) to a message... Realistically, it would be better if "Followup" were "Reply (in group)" and the default as a combo button/dropdown. And "Reply" replaced with "Reply (via Email)" or similar.

I'm not sure where I would/could submit this suggestion... it's exceedingly annoying that there doesn't seem to be a way to change/modify this order, let alone improve the behavior.
creator: tracker11

title: Renaming a mailing list
content: I need to change the name of a mailing list in Address Book under Personal Address Book. It is currently named HOA Email (for example), and I want to change it to HOA Residents. Sounds simple enough but I can't find any way to do it. I've searched Help but can't find anything that addresses this specific problem.

Don djordan@fire2wire.com
